results.name: Number of ordered ways to write n = x^3*(x+1) + y*(y+1)/2 + z*(3z+2), where x and y are nonnegative integers, and z is an integer.
comment: (ii) Any natural number can be written as x*(x^3+2) + y*(y+1)/2 + z*(3z+1), where x and y are nonnegative integers, and z is an integer.
(iii) Every n = 0,1,2,... can be written as x*(x^3+x^2+6) + y*(y+1)/2 + z*(3z+2) (or x*(x^3+x^2+4x+1) + y*(y+1)/2 + z*(3z+1)), where x and y are nonnegative integers, and z is an integer.
See also A270533 for a similar conjecture.
